content:
Here's a complete parts list for the development kit:

1. Core Computing:
- Raspberry Pi 4B 4GB ($45)
- 32GB MicroSD Card ($8)
- 5V 3A USB-C Power Supply ($8)

2. Sensors & Interaction:
- MPU-6050 Accelerometer/Gyro ($4)
- Capacitive Touch Sensors x4 ($12)
- Mini Speaker ($5)
- USB Microphone ($10)
- Raspberry Pi Camera V2 ($25)

3. Power Management:
- 5000mAh LiPo Battery ($20)
- Battery Management Board ($8)
- Power Switch ($2)

4. Development Tools:
- USB Logic Analyzer ($15)
- Digital Multimeter ($25)
- Temperature Probe ($10)
- GPIO Breakout Board ($8)

5. Case & Assembly:
- Basic 3D Printed Shell ($30)
- Jumper Wires Kit ($8)
- Headers & Connectors ($5)
- Thermal Pads ($4)

Total: ~$252

Recommended suppliers:
- Main electronics: Adafruit/Sparkfun
- Pi: Approved Raspberry Pi resellers
- 3D printing: Local maker space

Would you like me to create a detailed wiring diagram once you have the parts?
